attributes.action: Do you regret voting to 'leave the EU' and would want to re cast your vote?
attributes.additional_details: Various newspapers such as Daily Mail, Guardian etc has published the facts and expectations now after the vote. They contain more information such as the pound reaction, holiday costs, pensions, job losses, immigration not being controlled, NHS funding not being guaranteed.  Does anyone feel leave was not what they expected?
attributes.background: On the 23rd of June, the U.K. voted on whether to remain or leave the EU. Many of the facts were unclear but in the days since the vote we have seen the market reaction and clarification that immigration may not be as controlled as we expected nor is money guaranteed for NHS.  Any regrets?
